title: I want to learn what science is, as what does theory and fact mean and what counts as science and what doesn't. What books should I read? - Quora

response.answer_text: The short answer is as meany as you can. If you are just starting out and need to get to grips with the basics then you really cant go far wrong with the Science of Diskworld series. The Science of Discworld - Wikipedia Also if you’ve never read a Diskworld novel before you may find out why so meany people love them. If you would like a little more of an in depth look into some of the topics that are introduced in the Science of Diskworld books then you may also enjoy; A Brief History of Time - Wikipedia Why Does E=mc²? - Wikipedia The Greatest Show on Earth: The Evidence for Evolution - Wikipedia A Short History of Nearly Everything - Wikipedia Also in science a theory our best description of how nature works or does what it does. In order for something to be considered to be a theory in science it must; It must make falsifiable* predictions with consistent accuracy across a broad area of scientific inquiry.It must be well-supported by many independent strands of evidence, rather than a single foundation.It must be consistent with preexisting experimental results and at least as accurate in its predictions any preexisting theories.And a fact is something that is consistent with objective reality or can be proved with evidence. *This basically means that if it’s incorrect you can prove it, so for example the statement ‘All squares on a chess board are black’ is falsifiable.
